      UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/88.0.4324.104 Safari/537.36<span class="line"><!---->UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/88.0.4324.104 Safari/537.36<!----></span><br><br>Steps to reproduce the problem:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></span><br>You can reproduce this bug in two ways:<span class="line"><!---->You can reproduce this bug in two ways:<!----></span><br><br>[0] <span class="line"><!---->[0] <!----></span><br>Download sqlite 3.34.1 or above<span class="line"><!---->Download sqlite 3.34.1 or above<!----></span><br><br>gcc -DSQLITE_DEBUG shell.c sqlite3.c -pthread -ldl -o sqlite3<span class="line"><!---->gcc -DSQLITE_DEBUG shell.c sqlite3.c -pthread -ldl -o sqlite3<!----></span><br>./sqlite3 < poc.sql<span class="line"><!---->./sqlite3 &lt; poc.sql<!----></span><br><br>sakura@sakuradeMacBook-Pro:~/Downloads/sqlite-amalgamation-3340100$ ./sqlite3 < poc.sql<span class="line"><!---->sakura@sakuradeMacBook-Pro:~/Downloads/sqlite-amalgamation-3340100$ ./sqlite3 &lt; poc.sql<!----></span><br>Assertion failed: (pOp<pLastOp), function sqlite3WhereEnd, file sqlite3.c, line 151735.<span class="line"><!---->Assertion failed: (pOp&lt;pLastOp), function sqlite3WhereEnd, file sqlite3.c, line 151735.<!----></span><br>Abort trap: 6<span class="line"><!---->Abort trap: 6<!----></span><br><br>or<span class="line"><!---->or<!----></span><br><br>[1] patch chromium in sqlite3WhereEnd<span class="line"><!---->[1] patch chromium in sqlite3WhereEnd<!----></span><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/sqlite/src/amalgamation/sqlite3.c<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/sqlite/src/amalgamation/sqlite3.c"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/sqlite/src/amalgamation/sqlite3.c<!----></a><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>// assert( pOp<pLastOp); <span class="line"><!---->// assert( pOp&lt;pLastOp); <!----></span><br>+     if( pOp >= pLastOp)<span class="line"><!---->+     if( pOp &gt;= pLastOp)<!----></span><br>+         exit(-1);<span class="line"><!---->+         exit(-1);<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>The issue occurs when the codeTriggerProgram function is used to generate the VDBE code of the statement in a single trigger body.<span class="line"><!---->The issue occurs when the codeTriggerProgram function is used to generate the VDBE code of the statement in a single trigger body.<!----></span><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>      default: assert( pStep->op==TK_SELECT ); {<span class="line"><!---->      default: assert( pStep-&gt;op==TK_SELECT ); {<!----></span><br>        SelectDest sDest;<span class="line"><!---->        SelectDest sDest;<!----></span><br>        Select *pSelect = sqlite3SelectDup(db, pStep->pSelect, 0);<span class="line"><!---->        Select *pSelect = sqlite3SelectDup(db, pStep-&gt;pSelect, 0);<!----></span><br>        sqlite3SelectDestInit(&sDest, SRT_Discard, 0);<span class="line"><!---->        sqlite3SelectDestInit(&amp;sDest, SRT_Discard, 0);<!----></span><br>        sqlite3Select(pParse, pSelect, &sDest);<span class="line"><!---->        sqlite3Select(pParse, pSelect, &amp;sDest);<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>SQLite will perform query optimization when generating the select statement `SELECT (SELECT c0, c1 FROM t0) FROM t0`, and at the end of sqlite3Select, the following functions will be executed in sequence.<span class="line"><!---->SQLite will perform query optimization when generating the select statement `SELECT (SELECT c0, c1 FROM t0) FROM t0`, and at the end of sqlite3Select, the following functions will be executed in sequence.<!----></span><br><br>- sqlite3WhereBegin<span class="line"><!---->- sqlite3WhereBegin<!----></span><br>sqlite3WhereBegin generates VDBE OPCode for `SELECT (SELECT c0, c1 FROM t0) FROM t0` by calling the following function:<span class="line"><!---->sqlite3WhereBegin generates VDBE OPCode for `SELECT (SELECT c0, c1 FROM t0) FROM t0` by calling the following function:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>sqlite3WhereSplit // separate where statement<span class="line"><!---->sqlite3WhereSplit // separate where statement<!----></span><br>sqlite3WhereExprAnalyze //Analyze all sub expressions<span class="line"><!---->sqlite3WhereExprAnalyze //Analyze all sub expressions<!----></span><br>sqlite3WhereCodeOneLoopStart //Generate query operation<span class="line"><!---->sqlite3WhereCodeOneLoopStart //Generate query operation<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>The generated opcode:<span class="line"><!---->The generated opcode:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>foreach row1 in t1 do \ Code generated<span class="line"><!---->foreach row1 in t1 do \ Code generated<!----></span><br>    foreach row2 in t2 do |-- by sqlite3WhereBegin()<span class="line"><!---->    foreach row2 in t2 do |-- by sqlite3WhereBegin()<!----></span><br>        foreach row3 in t3 do /<span class="line"><!---->        foreach row3 in t3 do /<!----></span><br>        ...<span class="line"><!---->        ...<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>In sqlite3WhereBegin, use **pLevel->addrBody** to record the starting opcode position of each level loop, and then sqlite3WhereCodeOneLoopStart generates the Opcode corresponding to the iLevel layer.<span class="line"><!---->In sqlite3WhereBegin, use **pLevel-&gt;addrBody** to record the starting opcode position of each level loop, and then sqlite3WhereCodeOneLoopStart generates the Opcode corresponding to the iLevel layer.<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>    pLevel->addrBody = sqlite3VdbeCurrentAddr(v);<span class="line"><!---->    pLevel-&gt;addrBody = sqlite3VdbeCurrentAddr(v);<!----></span><br>    notReady = sqlite3WhereCodeOneLoopStart(pParse,v,pWInfo,ii,pLevel,notReady);<span class="line"><!---->    notReady = sqlite3WhereCodeOneLoopStart(pParse,v,pWInfo,ii,pLevel,notReady);<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>- selectInnerLoop<span class="line"><!---->- selectInnerLoop<!----></span><br>Here is used to generate the opcode corresponding to the result column of `SELECT c0, c1 FROM t0`<span class="line"><!---->Here is used to generate the opcode corresponding to the result column of `SELECT c0, c1 FROM t0`<!----></span><br><br>There is the following call chain in this function:<span class="line"><!---->There is the following call chain in this function:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>selectInnerLoop<span class="line"><!---->selectInnerLoop<!----></span><br>  ->innerLoopLoadRow<span class="line"><!---->  -&gt;innerLoopLoadRow<!----></span><br>    ->sqlite3ExprCodeExprList<span class="line"><!---->    -&gt;sqlite3ExprCodeExprList<!----></span><br>        ->sqlite3ExprCodeTarget<span class="line"><!---->        -&gt;sqlite3ExprCodeTarget<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>Under normal circumstances, for example, when the result column is a normal column, the following code will be called to create the opcode corresponding to the result column<span class="line"><!---->Under normal circumstances, for example, when the result column is a normal column, the following code will be called to create the opcode corresponding to the result column<!----></span><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>iReg = sqlite3ExprCodeGetColumn(pParse, pExpr->y.pTab,<span class="line"><!---->iReg = sqlite3ExprCodeGetColumn(pParse, pExpr-&gt;y.pTab,<!----></span><br>                               pExpr->iColumn, iTab, target,<span class="line"><!---->                               pExpr-&gt;iColumn, iTab, target,<!----></span><br>                               pExpr->op2);<span class="line"><!---->                               pExpr-&gt;op2);<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>But there is a switch in sqlite3ExprCodeTarget, that is, when the result column is a select statement, it will calculate whether `pExpr->x.pSelect->pEList->nExpr` is 1, due to `SELECT c0, c1 FROM t0` The number of results is 2(c0,c1...), so the execution reaches the exception handling sqlite3SubselectError(pParse, nCol, 1);<span class="line"><!---->But there is a switch in sqlite3ExprCodeTarget, that is, when the result column is a select statement, it will calculate whether `pExpr-&gt;x.pSelect-&gt;pEList-&gt;nExpr` is 1, due to `SELECT c0, c1 FROM t0` The number of results is 2(c0,c1...), so the execution reaches the exception handling sqlite3SubselectError(pParse, nCol, 1);<!----></span><br><br>And does not generate any opcode<span class="line"><!---->And does not generate any opcode<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>case TK_SELECT: {<span class="line"><!---->case TK_SELECT: {<!----></span><br>      int nCol;<span class="line"><!---->      int nCol;<!----></span><br>      testcase( op==TK_EXISTS );<span class="line"><!---->      testcase( op==TK_EXISTS );<!----></span><br>      testcase( op==TK_SELECT );<span class="line"><!---->      testcase( op==TK_SELECT );<!----></span><br>      if( pParse->db->mallocFailed ){<span class="line"><!---->      if( pParse-&gt;db-&gt;mallocFailed ){<!----></span><br>        return 0;<span class="line"><!---->        return 0;<!----></span><br>      }else if( op==TK_SELECT && (nCol = pExpr->x.pSelect->pEList->nExpr)!=1 ){<span class="line"><!---->      }else if( op==TK_SELECT &amp;&amp; (nCol = pExpr-&gt;x.pSelect-&gt;pEList-&gt;nExpr)!=1 ){<!----></span><br>        sqlite3SubselectError(pParse, nCol, 1);<span class="line"><!---->        sqlite3SubselectError(pParse, nCol, 1);<!----></span><br>      }else{<span class="line"><!---->      }else{<!----></span><br>        return sqlite3CodeSubselect(pParse, pExpr);<span class="line"><!---->        return sqlite3CodeSubselect(pParse, pExpr);<!----></span><br>      }<span class="line"><!---->      }<!----></span><br>      break;<span class="line"><!---->      break;<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>- sqlite3WhereEnd<span class="line"><!---->- sqlite3WhereEnd<!----></span><br>This function will Generate the end of the WHERE loop.<span class="line"><!---->This function will Generate the end of the WHERE loop.<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>** end \ Code generated<span class="line"><!---->** end \ Code generated<!----></span><br>** end |-- by sqlite3WhereEnd()<span class="line"><!---->** end |-- by sqlite3WhereEnd()<!----></span><br>** end /<span class="line"><!---->** end /<!----></span><br>**<span class="line"><!---->**<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>Since selectInnerLoop did not correctly generate the result column, last and k are equal, that is, the start VdbeOp pOp of the level and the end VdbeOp pLastOp are equal, triggering an assert crash.<span class="line"><!---->Since selectInnerLoop did not correctly generate the result column, last and k are equal, that is, the start VdbeOp pOp of the level and the end VdbeOp pLastOp are equal, triggering an assert crash.<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>int iEnd = sqlite3VdbeCurrentAddr(v);<span class="line"><!---->int iEnd = sqlite3VdbeCurrentAddr(v);<!----></span><br>...<span class="line"><!---->...<!----></span><br>if( pWInfo->eOnePass==ONEPASS_OFF || !HasRowid(pIdx->pTable) ){<span class="line"><!---->if( pWInfo-&gt;eOnePass==ONEPASS_OFF || !HasRowid(pIdx-&gt;pTable) ){<!----></span><br>        last = iEnd;<span class="line"><!---->        last = iEnd;<!----></span><br>...<span class="line"><!---->...<!----></span><br>k = pLevel->addrBody + 1;<span class="line"><!---->k = pLevel-&gt;addrBody + 1;<!----></span><br>pOp = sqlite3VdbeGetOp(v, k);<span class="line"><!---->pOp = sqlite3VdbeGetOp(v, k);<!----></span><br>pLastOp = pOp + (last-k);<span class="line"><!---->pLastOp = pOp + (last-k);<!----></span><br>assert( pOp<pLastOp );// crash here!<span class="line"><!---->assert( pOp&lt;pLastOp );// crash here!<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>(lldb) bt<span class="line"><!---->(lldb) bt<!----></span><br>* thread #1, queue = 'com.apple.main-thread', stop reason = breakpoint 9.1<span class="line"><!---->* thread #1, queue = 'com.apple.main-thread', stop reason = breakpoint 9.1<!----></span><br>  * frame #0: 0x0000000101d1815d main`sqlite3Select(pParse=0x00007ffeee14f7e0, p=0x000060c0000007c0, pDest=0x00007ffeee14ad00) at sqlite3.c:136167:23<span class="line"><!---->  * frame #0: 0x0000000101d1815d main`sqlite3Select(pParse=0x00007ffeee14f7e0, p=0x000060c0000007c0, pDest=0x00007ffeee14ad00) at sqlite3.c:136167:23<!----></span><br>    frame #1: main`sqlite3RunParser(pParse=0x00007ffeee14f7e0, zSql="", pzErrMsg=0x00007ffeee14f7c0) at sqlite3.c:161204:5<span class="line"><!---->    frame #3: 0x0000000101afb7a5         by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>

      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          Needs-Feedback
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          Blink&gt;Storage&gt;WebSQL

      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Is it possible to trigger this issue from Chromium without patching the code?  If not, then we can treat this as an issue in SQLite itself (either way we'd want to get it fixed, though).<span class="line"><!---->Is it possible to trigger this issue from Chromium without patching the code?  If not, then we can treat this as an issue in SQLite itself (either way we'd want to get it fixed, though).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Per the description, the Chrome repro only works if Chrome is patched. Therefore,  unless we know of a Chrome repro without a patch, this issue doesn't repro in Chrome and should be treated as a SQLite issue (but not a Chrome issue). Marking as Security_Impact-None for Chrome, as no current builds are affected.<span class="line"><!---->Per the description, the Chrome repro only works if Chrome is patched. Therefore,  unless we know of a Chrome repro without a patch, this issue doesn't repro in Chrome and should be treated as a SQLite issue (but not a Chrome issue). Marking as Security_Impact-None for Chrome, as no current builds are affected.<!----></span><br><br>That said, this does repro on sqlite 3.34.1 without any patches, so I'll send this over to the sqlite authors. Dr. Hipp and Daniel, please take a look? It seems that an assert is being reached on DEBUG builds. I'm aware this means that something that "shouldn't happen" is happening, but as this is just on debug, I'm unsure whether you'd consider this to be a security issue.<span class="line"><!---->That said, this does repro on sqlite 3.34.1 without any patches, so I'll send this over to the sqlite authors. Dr. Hipp and Daniel, please take a look? It seems that an assert is being reached on DEBUG builds. I'm aware this means that something that "shouldn't happen" is happening, but as this is just on debug, I'm unsure whether you'd consider this to be a security issue.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

    <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Feb 3, 2021, 7:42 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1173511#c9">Comment 9<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Feb 3, 2021, 7:42 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1173511#c9">Comment 9<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Feb 3, 2021, 7:42 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        Thank you for the report.  This is a non-problem.  It is a faulty assert() statement in the bytecode generator that might be off-by-one when there are prior errors in the parse.  The surrounding code is fine.  The problem was in the assert() and since assert() is disabled by default for release builds of SQLite, that means this cannot come up in the wild.  Nevertheless, it is good to have it fixed.  The fix is here: <span class="line"><!---->Thank you for the report.  This is a non-problem.  It is a faulty assert() statement in the bytecode generator that might be off-by-one when there are prior errors in the parse.  The surrounding code is fine.  The problem was in the assert() and since assert() is disabled by default for release builds of SQLite, that means this cannot come up in the wild.  Nevertheless, it is good to have it fixed.  The fix is here: <!----></span>https://www.sqlite.org/src/timeline?c=06b15b17be38c804<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.sqlite.org/src/timeline?c=06b15b17be38c804"><!---->https://www.sqlite.org/src/timeline?c=06b15b17be38c804<!----></a><br><br>The problem was introduced on 2020-08-14.  By sheer coincidence, our own internal fuzzer found the exact same problem last night.  :-)<span class="line"><!---->The problem was introduced on 2020-08-14.  By sheer coincidence, our own internal fuzzer found the exact same problem last night.  :-)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        Actually, we technically don't know that this *won't* be a security concern, so we should treat it as such for now.<span class="line"><!---->Actually, we technically don't know that this *won't* be a security concern, so we should treat it as such for now.<!----></span><br><br>Marking as Security_Impact-Stable as the bug exposed here, if exploitable without a patch, affects Stable (as it was here for a while). Marking as Security_Impact-High as an off-by-one could in theory be part of a larger exploit that could pwn a renderer. I'll try putting this on main/Chrome Canary, and then allow the security team to assess impact further before placing on beta/stable.<span class="line"><!---->Marking as Security_Impact-Stable as the bug exposed here, if exploitable without a patch, affects Stable (as it was here for a while). Marking as Security_Impact-High as an off-by-one could in theory be part of a larger exploit that could pwn a renderer. I'll try putting this on main/Chrome Canary, and then allow the security team to assess impact further before placing on beta/stable.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        > Actually, we technically don't know that this *won't* be a security concern<span class="line"><!---->&gt; Actually, we technically don't know that this *won't* be a security concern<!----></span><br><br>Yeah we do.  The problem was not in core SQLite used by Chrome, but in debugging code that happens to live in the same source code file.  The code that contain the problem is not part of a non-debug build.  The code that contains the problem does not result in any new or different machine-code being added to Chrome.  As far as Chrome is concerned, the problem was in a comment.<span class="line"><!---->Yeah we do.  The problem was not in core SQLite used by Chrome, but in debugging code that happens to live in the same source code file.  The code that contain the problem is not part of a non-debug build.  The code that contains the problem does not result in any new or different machine-code being added to Chrome.  As far as Chrome is concerned, the problem was in a comment.<!----></span><br><br>And for that matter, the "problem" merely caused a premature call to abort() and was not really a problem in the sense of being something exploitable.<span class="line"><!---->And for that matter, the "problem" merely caused a premature call to abort() and was not really a problem in the sense of being something exploitable.<!----></span><br><br>I don't see any way that this could be a security concern.<span class="line"><!---->I don't see any way that this could be a security concern.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        <div class="target-project-dialog">
          <h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>

            <label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

          

          <div class="edit-actions">
            <chops-button class="de-emphasized">
              Cancel
            </chops-button>
            <chops-button class="emphasized">
               issue
            </chops-button>
          </div>
        </div>

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }

          cursor: pointer;

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {

          top: var(--monorail-header-height);

        mr-launch-overview {

            <div class="container-issue-content">
              <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);
          padding-bottom: 1em;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          flex-direction: column;
          margin: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
        }
        h3 {
          margin-top: 1em;
        }
        mr-description {
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->focus on the issue search field<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->c<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->compose a new issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
        </div>
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>
      </chops-dialog>
    <mr-keystrokes></mr-keystrokes>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>


          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

problem:<!----></span><br>You can reproduce this bug in two ways:<span class="line"><!---->You can reproduce this bug in two ways:<!----></span><br><br>[0] <span class="line"><!---->[0] <!----></span><br>Download sqlite 3.34.1 or above<span class="line"><!---->Download sqlite 3.34.1 or above<!----></span><br><br>gcc -DSQLITE_DEBUG shell.c sqlite3.c -pthread -ldl -o sqlite3<span class="line"><!---->gcc -DSQLITE_DEBUG shell.c sqlite3.c -pthread -ldl -o sqlite3<!----></span><br>./sqlite3 < poc.sql<span class="line"><!---->./sqlite3 &lt; poc.sql<!----></span><br><br>sakura@sakuradeMacBook-Pro:~/Downloads/sqlite-amalgamation-3340100$ ./sqlite3 < poc.sql<span class="line"><!---->sakura@sakuradeMacBook-Pro:~/Downloads/sqlite-amalgamation-3340100$ ./sqlite3 &lt; poc.sql<!----></span><br>Assertion failed: (pOp<pLastOp), function sqlite3WhereEnd, file sqlite3.c, line 151735.<span class="line"><!---->Assertion failed: (pOp&lt;pLastOp), function sqlite3WhereEnd, file sqlite3.c, line 151735.<!----></span><br>Abort trap: 6<span class="line"><!---->Abort trap: 6<!----></span><br><br>or<span class="line"><!---->or<!----></span><br><br>[1] patch chromium in sqlite3WhereEnd<span class="line"><!---->[1] patch chromium in sqlite3WhereEnd<!----></span><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/sqlite/src/amalgamation/sqlite3.c<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/sqlite/src/amalgamation/sqlite3.c"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/sqlite/src/amalgamation/sqlite3.c<!----></a><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>// assert( pOp<pLastOp); <span class="line"><!---->// assert( pOp&lt;pLastOp); <!----></span><br>+     if( pOp >= pLastOp)<span class="line"><!---->+     if( pOp &gt;= pLastOp)<!----></span><br>+         exit(-1);<span class="line"><!---->+         exit(-1);<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>The issue occurs when the codeTriggerProgram function is used to generate the VDBE code of the statement in a single trigger body.<span class="line"><!---->The issue occurs when the codeTriggerProgram function is used to generate the VDBE code of the statement in a single trigger body.<!----></span><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>      default: assert( pStep->op==TK_SELECT ); {<span class="line"><!---->      default: assert( pStep-&gt;op==TK_SELECT ); {<!----></span><br>        SelectDest sDest;<span class="line"><!---->        SelectDest sDest;<!----></span><br>        Select *pSelect = sqlite3SelectDup(db, pStep->pSelect, 0);<span class="line"><!---->        Select *pSelect = sqlite3SelectDup(db, pStep-&gt;pSelect, 0);<!----></span><br>        sqlite3SelectDestInit(&sDest, SRT_Discard, 0);<span class="line"><!---->        sqlite3SelectDestInit(&amp;sDest, SRT_Discard, 0);<!----></span><br>        sqlite3Select(pParse, pSelect, &sDest);<span class="line"><!---->        sqlite3Select(pParse, pSelect, &amp;sDest);<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>SQLite will perform query optimization when generating the select statement `SELECT (SELECT c0, c1 FROM t0) FROM t0`, and at the end of sqlite3Select, the following functions will be executed in sequence.<span class="line"><!---->SQLite will perform query optimization when generating the select statement `SELECT (SELECT c0, c1 FROM t0) FROM t0`, and at the end of sqlite3Select, the following functions will be executed in sequence.<!----></span><br><br>- sqlite3WhereBegin<span class="line"><!---->- sqlite3WhereBegin<!----></span><br>sqlite3WhereBegin generates VDBE OPCode for `SELECT (SELECT c0, c1 FROM t0) FROM t0` by calling the following function:<span class="line"><!---->sqlite3WhereBegin generates VDBE OPCode for `SELECT (SELECT c0, c1 FROM t0) FROM t0` by calling the following function:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>sqlite3WhereSplit // separate where statement<span class="line"><!---->sqlite3WhereSplit // separate where statement<!----></span><br>sqlite3WhereExprAnalyze //Analyze all sub expressions<span class="line"><!---->sqlite3WhereExprAnalyze //Analyze all sub expressions<!----></span><br>sqlite3WhereCodeOneLoopStart //Generate query operation<span class="line"><!---->sqlite3WhereCodeOneLoopStart //Generate query operation<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>The generated opcode:<span class="line"><!---->The generated opcode:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>foreach row1 in t1 do \ Code generated<span class="line"><!---->foreach row1 in t1 do \ Code generated<!----></span><br>    foreach row2 in t2 do |-- by sqlite3WhereBegin()<span class="line"><!---->    foreach row2 in t2 do |-- by sqlite3WhereBegin()<!----></span><br>        foreach row3 in t3 do /<span class="line"><!---->        foreach row3 in t3 do /<!----></span><br>        ...<span class="line"><!---->        ...<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>In sqlite3WhereBegin, use **pLevel->addrBody** to record the starting opcode position of each level loop, and then sqlite3WhereCodeOneLoopStart generates the Opcode corresponding to the iLevel layer.<span class="line"><!---->In sqlite3WhereBegin, use **pLevel-&gt;addrBody** to record the starting opcode position of each level loop, and then sqlite3WhereCodeOneLoopStart generates the Opcode corresponding to the iLevel layer.<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>    pLevel->addrBody = sqlite3VdbeCurrentAddr(v);<span class="line"><!---->    pLevel-&gt;addrBody = sqlite3VdbeCurrentAddr(v);<!----></span><br>    notReady = sqlite3WhereCodeOneLoopStart(pParse,v,pWInfo,ii,pLevel,notReady);<span class="line"><!---->    notReady = sqlite3WhereCodeOneLoopStart(pParse,v,pWInfo,ii,pLevel,notReady);<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>- selectInnerLoop<span class="line"><!---->- selectInnerLoop<!----></span><br>Here is used to generate the opcode corresponding to the result column of `SELECT c0, c1 FROM t0`<span class="line"><!---->Here is used to generate the opcode corresponding to the result column of `SELECT c0, c1 FROM t0`<!----></span><br><br>There is the following call chain in this function:<span class="line"><!---->There is the following call chain in this function:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>selectInnerLoop<span class="line"><!---->selectInnerLoop<!----></span><br>  ->innerLoopLoadRow<span class="line"><!---->  -&gt;innerLoopLoadRow<!----></span><br>    ->sqlite3ExprCodeExprList<span class="line"><!---->    -&gt;sqlite3ExprCodeExprList<!----></span><br>        ->sqlite3ExprCodeTarget<span class="line"><!---->        -&gt;sqlite3ExprCodeTarget<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>Under normal circumstances, for example, when the result column is a normal column, the following code will be called to create the opcode corresponding to the result column<span class="line"><!---->Under normal circumstances, for example, when the result column is a normal column, the following code will be called to create the opcode corresponding to the result column<!----></span><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>iReg = sqlite3ExprCodeGetColumn(pParse, pExpr->y.pTab,<span class="line"><!---->iReg = sqlite3ExprCodeGetColumn(pParse, pExpr-&gt;y.pTab,<!----></span><br>                               pExpr->iColumn, iTab, target,<span class="line"><!---->                               pExpr-&gt;iColumn, iTab, target,<!----></span><br>                               pExpr->op2);<span class="line"><!---->                               pExpr-&gt;op2);<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>But there is a switch in sqlite3ExprCodeTarget, that is, when the result column is a select statement, it will calculate whether `pExpr->x.pSelect->pEList->nExpr` is 1, due to `SELECT c0, c1 FROM t0` The number of results is 2(c0,c1...), so the execution reaches the exception handling sqlite3SubselectError(pParse, nCol, 1);<span class="line"><!---->But there is a switch in sqlite3ExprCodeTarget, that is, when the result column is a select statement, it will calculate whether `pExpr-&gt;x.pSelect-&gt;pEList-&gt;nExpr` is 1, due to `SELECT c0, c1 FROM t0` The number of results is 2(c0,c1...), so the execution reaches the exception handling sqlite3SubselectError(pParse, nCol, 1);<!----></span><br><br>And does not generate any opcode<span class="line"><!---->And does not generate any opcode<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>case TK_SELECT: {<span class="line"><!---->case TK_SELECT: {<!----></span><br>      int nCol;<span class="line"><!---->      int nCol;<!----></span><br>      testcase( op==TK_EXISTS );<span class="line"><!---->      testcase( op==TK_EXISTS );<!----></span><br>      testcase( op==TK_SELECT );<span class="line"><!---->      testcase( op==TK_SELECT );<!----></span><br>      if( pParse->db->mallocFailed ){<span class="line"><!---->      if( pParse-&gt;db-&gt;mallocFailed ){<!----></span><br>        return 0;<span class="line"><!---->        return 0;<!----></span><br>      }else if( op==TK_SELECT && (nCol = pExpr->x.pSelect->pEList->nExpr)!=1 ){<span class="line"><!---->      }else if( op==TK_SELECT &amp;&amp; (nCol = pExpr-&gt;x.pSelect-&gt;pEList-&gt;nExpr)!=1 ){<!----></span><br>        sqlite3SubselectError(pParse, nCol, 1);<span class="line"><!---->        sqlite3SubselectError(pParse, nCol, 1);<!----></span><br>      }else{<span class="line"><!---->      }else{<!----></span><br>        return sqlite3CodeSubselect(pParse, pExpr);<span class="line"><!---->        return sqlite3CodeSubselect(pParse, pExpr);<!----></span><br>      }<span class="line"><!---->      }<!----></span><br>      break;<span class="line"><!---->      break;<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>- sqlite3WhereEnd<span class="line"><!---->- sqlite3WhereEnd<!----></span><br>This function will Generate the end of the WHERE loop.<span class="line"><!---->This function will Generate the end of the WHERE loop.<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>** end \ Code generated<span class="line"><!---->** end \ Code generated<!----></span><br>** end |-- by sqlite3WhereEnd()<span class="line"><!---->** end |-- by sqlite3WhereEnd()<!----></span><br>** end /<span class="line"><!---->** end /<!----></span><br>**<span class="line"><!---->**<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>Since selectInnerLoop did not correctly generate the result column, last and k are equal, that is, the start VdbeOp pOp of the level and the end VdbeOp pLastOp are equal, triggering an assert crash.<span class="line"><!---->Since selectInnerLoop did not correctly generate the result column, last and k are equal, that is, the start VdbeOp pOp of the level and the end VdbeOp pLastOp are equal, triggering an assert crash.<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>int iEnd = sqlite3VdbeCurrentAddr(v);<span class="line"><!---->int iEnd = sqlite3VdbeCurrentAddr(v);<!----></span><br>...<span class="line"><!---->...<!----></span><br>if( pWInfo->eOnePass==ONEPASS_OFF || !HasRowid(pIdx->pTable) ){<span class="line"><!---->if( pWInfo-&gt;eOnePass==ONEPASS_OFF || !HasRowid(pIdx-&gt;pTable) ){<!----></span><br>        last = iEnd;<span class="line"><!---->        last = iEnd;<!----></span><br>...<span class="line"><!---->...<!----></span><br>k = pLevel->addrBody + 1;<span class="line"><!---->k = pLevel-&gt;addrBody + 1;<!----></span><br>pOp = sqlite3VdbeGetOp(v, k);<span class="line"><!---->pOp = sqlite3VdbeGetOp(v, k);<!----></span><br>pLastOp = pOp + (last-k);<span class="line"><!---->pLastOp = pOp + (last-k);<!----></span><br>assert( pOp<pLastOp );// crash here!<span class="line"><!---->assert( pOp&lt;pLastOp );// crash here!<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>(lldb) bt<span class="line"><!---->(lldb) bt<!----></span><br>* thread #1, queue = 'com.apple.main-thread', stop reason = breakpoint 9.1<span class="line"><!---->* thread #1, queue = 'com.apple.main-thread', stop reason = breakpoint 9.1<!----></span><br>  * frame #0: 0x0000000101d1815d main`sqlite3Select(pParse=0x00007ffeee14f7e0, p=0x000060c0000007c0, pDest=0x00007ffeee14ad00) at sqlite3.c:136167:23<span class="line"><!---->  * frame #0: 0x0000000101d1815d main`sqlite3Select(pParse=0x00007ffeee14f7e0, p=0x000060c0000007c0, pDest=0x00007ffeee14ad00) at sqlite3.c:136167:23<!----></span><br>    frame #1: 0x0000000101ce5d82 main`yy_reduce(yypParser=0x00007ffeee14e8b0, yyruleno=82, yyLookahead=1, yyLookaheadToken=(z = "", n = 0), pParse=0x00007ffeee14f7e0) at sqlite3.c:158623:3<span class="line"><!---->         Per the description, the Chrome repro only works if Chrome is patched. Therefore,  unless we know of a Chrome repro without a patch, this issue doesn't repro in Chrome and should be treated as a SQLite issue (but not a Chrome issue). Marking as Security_Impact-None for Chrome, as no current builds are affected.<span class="line"><!---->Per the description, the Chrome repro only works if Chrome is patched. Therefore,  unless we know of a Chrome repro without a patch, this issue doesn't repro in Chrome and should be treated as a SQLite issue (but not a Chrome issue). Marking as Security_Impact-None for Chrome, as no current builds are affected.<!----></span><br><br>That said, this does repro on sqlite 3.34.1 without any patches, so I'll send this over to the sqlite authors. Dr. Hipp and Daniel, please take a look? It seems that an assert is being reached on DEBUG builds. I'm aware this means that something that "shouldn't happen" is happening, but as this is just on debug, I'm unsure whether you'd consider this to be a security issue.<span class="line"><!---->That said, this does repro on sqlite 3.34.1 without any patches, so I'll send this over to the sqlite authors. Dr. Hipp and Daniel, please take a look? It seems that an assert is being reached on DEBUG builds. I'm aware this means that something that "shouldn't happen" is happening, but as this is just on debug, I'm unsure whether you'd consider this to be a security issue.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 9<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1173511#c9">Comment 9<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      drhsq...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/527008495" title="drhsq...@gmail.com"><!---->drhsq...@gmail.com<!----></a>
      drhsq...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->drhsq...@gmail.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Wed, Feb 3, 2021, 7:42 AM EST
    <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Feb 3, 2021, 7:42 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1173511#c9">Comment 9<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Feb 3, 2021, 7:42 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1173511#c9">Comment 9<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Feb 3, 2021, 7:42 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        Thank you for the report.  This is a non-problem.  It is a faulty assert() statement in the bytecode generator that might be off-by-one when there are prior errors in the parse.  The surrounding code is fine.  The problem was in the assert() and since assert() is disabled by default for release builds of SQLite, that means this cannot come up in the wild.  Nevertheless, it is good to have it fixed.  The fix is here: <span class="line"><!---->Thank you for the report.  This is a non-problem.  It is a faulty assert() statement in the bytecode generator that might be off-by-one when there are prior errors in the parse.  The surrounding code is fine.  The problem was in the assert() and since assert() is disabled by default for release builds of SQLite, that means this cannot come up in the wild.  Nevertheless, it is good to have it fixed.  The fix is here: <!----></span>https://www.sqlite.org/src/timeline?c=06b15b17be38c804<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.sqlite.org/src/timeline?c=06b15b17be38c804"><!---->https://www.sqlite.org/src/timeline?c=06b15b17be38c804<!----></a><br><br>The problem was introduced on 2020-08-14.  By sheer coincidence, our own internal fuzzer found the exact same problem last night.  :-)<span class="line"><!---->The problem was introduced on 2020-08-14.  By sheer coincidence, our own internal fuzzer found the exact same problem last night.  :-)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

          Comment 12<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1173511#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

        Actually, we technically don't know that this *won't* be a security concern, so we should treat it as such for now.<span class="line"><!---->Actually, we technically don't know that this *won't* be a security concern, so we should treat it as such for now.<!----></span><br><br>Marking as Security_Impact-Stable as the bug exposed here, if exploitable without a patch, affects Stable (as it was here for a while). Marking as Security_Impact-High as an off-by-one could in theory be part of a larger exploit that could pwn a renderer. I'll try putting this on main/Chrome Canary, and then allow the security team to assess impact further before placing on beta/stable.<span class="line"><!---->Marking as Security_Impact-Stable as the bug exposed here, if exploitable without a patch, affects Stable (as it was here for a while). Marking as Security_Impact-High as an off-by-one could in theory be part of a larger exploit that could pwn a renderer. I'll try putting this on main/Chrome Canary, and then allow the security team to assess impact further before placing on beta/stable.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        > Actually, we technically don't know that this *won't* be a security concern<span class="line"><!---->&gt; Actually, we technically don't know that this *won't* be a security concern<!----></span><br><br>Yeah we do.  The problem was not in core SQLite used by Chrome, but in debugging code that happens to live in the same source code file.  The code that contain the problem is not part of a non-debug build.  The code that contains the problem does not result in any new or different machine-code being added to Chrome.  As far as Chrome is concerned, the problem was in a comment.<span class="line"><!---->Yeah we do.  The problem was not in core SQLite used by Chrome, but in debugging code that happens to live in the same source code file.  The code that contain the problem is not part of a non-debug build.  The code that contains the problem does not result in any new or different machine-code being added to Chrome.  As far as Chrome is concerned, the problem was in a comment.<!----></span><br><br>And for that matter, the "problem" merely caused a premature call to abort() and was not really a problem in the sense of being something exploitable.<span class="line"><!---->And for that matter, the "problem" merely caused a premature call to abort() and was not really a problem in the sense of being something exploitable.<!----></span><br><br>I don't see any way that this could be a security concern.<span class="line"><!---->I don't see any way that this could be a security concern.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      <mr-click-throughs></mr-click-throughs>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
